caption.p: Effects of catechin (2, 5, 10, 15, 30, and 50 mg/kg) and glibenclamide (5 mg/kg) on liver and kidney oxidative stress markers in diabetic rat in STZ-induced diabetic rats. Oxidative stress markers in liver: ( A) GPx, ( B) malondialdehyde (MDA) ( C) glutathione (GSH). In kidney: ( D) GPx, ( E) MDA, ( F) GSH. The values are expressed as mean ± SEM. Each value corresponds to a mean of eight animals ### p ˂ 0.001; comparison of a(normal control) vs. b(diabetic control) using student t-test, * p ˂ 0.05, ** p ˂ 0.01, *** p < 0.001; comparison of b(diabetic control) vs. c(Glibenclamide and CTN treated groups) using one way ANOVA followed by Dunnett’s post hoc multiple comparison test.
